Detailed Description

Obsolete - the class Menu, which might use the ApplicationAction, has been replaced by the classes ItemMenu and ItemTree.

Informs a variable application, when the action has been executed by sending the message AppActionExecutedMsg asynchronously. Usually when an action has been executed, the message ActionExecutedMsg is send synchronously to the dispatcher of the action. But when embedding an action of one application into a menu of another application, a synchronous call is not allowed between applications, because each application may be represented by its own thread.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN ApplicationAction::Execute (   )  [virtual]
 

Sends the message AppActionExecutedMsg asynchronously to the application specified in the constructor. Note that the base-implementation, which sends the message ActionExecutedMsg to the dispatcher, is invoked too.

See also:
Action::Execute
